channel.title: Softball on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lincoln Blue Tigers Logo
The Lincoln Blue Tigers are the sports teams of Lincoln University in Jefferson City, Missouri. The Blue Tigers participate at the NCAA Division II level in Mid-America Intercollegiate Athletics Association. Lincoln competed in the MIAA from 1970 to 1999 when it left due to not sponsoring a football team since 1989. The university competed in the Heartland Conference from 1999 to 2010, of which, Lincoln is a founding conference member.
You can download theLincoln Blue Tigerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lincoln Blue Tigers
item.description: The Lincoln Blue Tigers are the sports teams of Lincoln University in Jefferson City, Missouri. The Blue Tigers participate at the NCAA Division II level in Mid-America Intercollegiate Athletics Association. Lincoln competed in the MIAA from 1970 to 1999 when it left due to not sponsoring a football team since 1989. The university competed in the Heartland Conference from 1999 to 2010, of which, Lincoln is a founding conference member.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
NYIT Bears Logo
The New York Tech Bears refer to the mascot and sports teams of the New York Institute of Technology, located in Old Westbury, New York, United States. All of New York Tech’s teams compete in NCAA Division II. The Bears are part of the East Coast Conference. Tech is best known for its men’s lacrosse team, which has won four NCAA Division II national championships. Tech also sent several runners to the Olympic Games, in 1980, 1988, 1992, and in 2000.
You can download theNYIT Bearslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: NYIT Bears
item.description: The New York Tech Bears refer to the mascot and sports teams of the New York Institute of Technology, located in Old Westbury, New York, United States. All of New York Tech’s teams compete in NCAA Division II. The Bears are part of the East Coast Conference. Tech is best known for its men’s lacrosse team, which has won four NCAA Division II national championships. Tech also sent several runners to the Olympic Games, in 1980, 1988, 1992, and in 2000.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
STAC Spartans Logo
St. Thomas Aquinas College provides students with the opportunity to participate in college athletics at the Division II, varsity, club, or intramural level. Located in Sparkill, New York, STAC is home to 20 NCAA DII Men’s and Women’s teams, plus varsity level sprint football and women’s triathlon. Learn more about them, watch highlights, see rosters and schedules, read news stories, and stay up-to-date with all things Spartans by visiting our Athletics Website and check out the latest action shots of our Spartans on the Athletics Flickr site.
You can download theSTAC Spartanslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: STAC Spartans
item.description: St. Thomas Aquinas College provides students with the opportunity to participate in college athletics at the Division II, varsity, club, or intramural level. Located in Sparkill, New York, STAC is home to 20 NCAA DII Men’s and Women’s teams, plus varsity level sprint football and women’s triathlon. Learn more about them, watch highlights, see rosters and schedules, read news stories, and stay up-to-date with all things Spartans by visiting our Athletics Website and check out the latest action shots of our Spartans on the Athletics Flickr site.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Mansfield Mountaineers Logo
The Mansfield Mountaineers or Mounties represent the Mansfield University of Pennsylvania, located in Mansfield, Pennsylvania, in NCAA Division II intercollegiate sports. The Mountaineers are members of the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference for eleven varsity sports. Mansfield University Sprint Football team participates in the Collegiate Sprint Football League. Mansfield have been members of the PSAC since its foundation in 1951 and a non-football member since 2007. Source
You can download theMansfield Mountaineerslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Mansfield Mountaineers
item.description: The Mansfield Mountaineers or Mounties represent the Mansfield University of Pennsylvania, located in Mansfield, Pennsylvania, in NCAA Division II intercollegiate sports. The Mountaineers are members of the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference for eleven varsity sports. Mansfield University Sprint Football team participates in the Collegiate Sprint Football League. Mansfield have been members of the PSAC since its foundation in 1951 and a non-football member since 2007. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Nyack Warriors Logo
Formerly the Purple Pride, and before that, the Fighting Parsons, Nyack’s athletes are now known as Warriors. The Warriors participate in the Central Atlantic Collegiate Conference of the NCAA’s Division II. In 2011, the men’s soccer team earned their first bid to the Division II NCAA tournament. Source
You can download theNyack Warriorslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Nyack Warriors
item.description: Formerly the Purple Pride, and before that, the Fighting Parsons, Nyack’s athletes are now known as Warriors. The Warriors participate in the Central Atlantic Collegiate Conference of the NCAA’s Division II. In 2011, the men’s soccer team earned their first bid to the Division II NCAA tournament. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Notre Dame De Namur Argonauts Logo
The Notre Dame de Namur University Argonauts were the athletic teams of the university until 2020. The university mascot, the Argonaut, is named for the mythical Argonauts who sailed with Jason in search of the Golden Fleece. The team colors blue, gold and white reflected the colors of the university. At the time of the discontinuation, NDNU had 12 varsity sports. Men’s sports included basketball, cross country, golf, lacrosse, soccer, and track and field while women’s sports included basketball, cross country, soccer, softball, tennis, track and field, and volleyball.
You can download theNotre Dame De Namur Argonautslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Notre Dame De Namur Argonauts
item.description: The Notre Dame de Namur University Argonauts were the athletic teams of the university until 2020. The university mascot, the Argonaut, is named for the mythical Argonauts who sailed with Jason in search of the Golden Fleece. The team colors blue, gold and white reflected the colors of the university. At the time of the discontinuation, NDNU had 12 varsity sports. Men’s sports included basketball, cross country, golf, lacrosse, soccer, and track and field while women’s sports included basketball, cross country, soccer, softball, tennis, track and field, and volleyball.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Rutgers Scarlet Knights Logo
The Rutgers Scarlet Knights are the athletic teams that represent Rutgers University’s New Brunswick campus. In sports, Rutgers is chiefly known for being the “Birthplace of College Football”, hosting the first ever intercollegiate football game on November 6, 1869 in which Rutgers defeated a team from the College of New Jersey with a score of 6 runs to 4. Among the first American schools to participate in intercollegiate athletics, Rutgers currently fields 27 teams in the Big Ten Conference which participates in Division I competition, as sanctioned by the National Collegiate Athletic Association in the following sports: baseball, basketball, crew, cross country, field hockey, football, golf, gymnastics, lacrosse, soccer, softball, tennis, track and field, swimming and diving, wrestling, and volleyball.
You can download theRutgers Scarlet Knightslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Rutgers Scarlet Knights
item.description: The Rutgers Scarlet Knights are the athletic teams that represent Rutgers University’s New Brunswick campus. In sports, Rutgers is chiefly known for being the “Birthplace of College Football”, hosting the first ever intercollegiate football game on November 6, 1869 in which Rutgers defeated a team from the College of New Jersey with a score of 6 runs to 4. Among the first American schools to participate in intercollegiate athletics, Rutgers currently fields 27 teams in the Big Ten Conference which participates in Division I competition, as sanctioned by the National Collegiate Athletic Association in the following sports: baseball, basketball, crew, cross country, field hockey, football, golf, gymnastics, lacrosse, soccer, softball, tennis, track and field, swimming and diving, wrestling, and volleyball.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Simon Fraser Clan Logo
The Simon Fraser Clan are the athletic teams that represent Simon Fraser University in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada. The Clan are members of NCAA Division II and are the only Canadian university affiliated with the U.S.-based National Collegiate Athletic Association. Source
You can download theSimon Fraser Clanlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Simon Fraser Clan
item.description: The Simon Fraser Clan are the athletic teams that represent Simon Fraser University in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada. The Clan are members of NCAA Division II and are the only Canadian university affiliated with the U.S.-based National Collegiate Athletic Association. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Green Bay Phoenix Logo
The Green Bay Phoenix, previously known as the UW–Green Bay Phoenix and UWGB Phoenix, are the athletic teams of the University of Wisconsin–Green Bay. A total of 15 Phoenix athletic teams compete in the Horizon League of NCAA Division I. The school does not sponsor an American football team. Source
You can download theGreen Bay Phoenixlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Green Bay Phoenix
item.description: The Green Bay Phoenix, previously known as the UW–Green Bay Phoenix and UWGB Phoenix, are the athletic teams of the University of Wisconsin–Green Bay. A total of 15 Phoenix athletic teams compete in the Horizon League of NCAA Division I. The school does not sponsor an American football team. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Saint Louis Billikens Logo
The Saint Louis Billikens are the collegiate athletic teams from Saint Louis University of St. Louis, Missouri. The Billikens compete in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association as a member of the Atlantic 10 Conference. The school has nationally recognized soccer programs for men and women. The school has heavily invested in its on-campus athletic facilities in the past twenty years with the creation of Hermann Stadium and Chaifetz Arena.
You can download theSaint Louis Billikenslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Saint Louis Billikens
item.description: The Saint Louis Billikens are the collegiate athletic teams from Saint Louis University of St. Louis, Missouri. The Billikens compete in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association as a member of the Atlantic 10 Conference. The school has nationally recognized soccer programs for men and women. The school has heavily invested in its on-campus athletic facilities in the past twenty years with the creation of Hermann Stadium and Chaifetz Arena.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bethune-Cookman Wildcats Logo The Bethune–Cookman Wildcats are the athletic teams that represent Bethune–Cookman University in Daytona Beach, Florida. They compete in the NCAA Division I Football Championship Subdivision primarily competing in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC) for all sports. In June 2020, BCU announced they will be joining the Southwestern Athletic Conference (SWAC) in summer 2021. Bethune–Cookman fields 15 teams, 7 men’s and 8 women’s, and have won 31 MEAC titles; 14 in baseball, 1 in bowling, 1 in men’s cross country, 2 in women’s cross country, 3 in football, 2 in women’s indoor track and field, 6 in softball and 2 in women’s tennis in history of their athletic program.
You can download theBethune Cookman Wildcatslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bethune Cookman Wildcats
item.description: The Bethune–Cookman Wildcats are the athletic teams that represent Bethune–Cookman University in Daytona Beach, Florida. They compete in the NCAA Division I Football Championship Subdivision primarily competing in the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC) for all sports. In June 2020, BCU announced they will be joining the Southwestern Athletic Conference (SWAC) in summer 2021. Bethune–Cookman fields 15 teams, 7 men’s and 8 women’s, and have won 31 MEAC titles; 14 in baseball, 1 in bowling, 1 in men’s cross country, 2 in women’s cross country, 3 in football, 2 in women’s indoor track and field, 6 in softball and 2 in women’s tennis in history of their athletic program.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Butler Bulldogs Logo
The Butler Bulldogs are the athletic teams that represent Butler University, located in Indianapolis, Indiana United States. The Bulldogs participate in 20 NCAA Division I intercollegiate sports. After leaving the Horizon League following the 2011–12 season, nearly all teams competed in the Atlantic 10 Conference. The football team is a founding member of the non-scholarship Football Championship Subdivision-level Pioneer League. On March 20, 2013, the Butler administration announced that the school would join the Big East, and moved to the new league July 1, 2013.
You can download theButler Bulldogslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Butler Bulldogs
item.description: The Butler Bulldogs are the athletic teams that represent Butler University, located in Indianapolis, Indiana United States. The Bulldogs participate in 20 NCAA Division I intercollegiate sports. After leaving the Horizon League following the 2011–12 season, nearly all teams competed in the Atlantic 10 Conference. The football team is a founding member of the non-scholarship Football Championship Subdivision-level Pioneer League. On March 20, 2013, the Butler administration announced that the school would join the Big East, and moved to the new league July 1, 2013.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets Logo
The Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets is the name used for all of the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent the Georgia Institute of Technology, located in Atlanta, Georgia. The teams have also been nicknamed the Ramblin' Wreck, Engineers, Blacksmiths, and Golden Tornado. There are eight men’s and seven women’s teams that compete in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I athletics and the Football Bowl Subdivision. Georgia Tech is a member of the Coastal Division in the Atlantic Coast Conference.
You can download theGeorgia Tech Yellow Jacketslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets
item.description: The Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets is the name used for all of the intercollegiate athletic teams that represent the Georgia Institute of Technology, located in Atlanta, Georgia. The teams have also been nicknamed the Ramblin' Wreck, Engineers, Blacksmiths, and Golden Tornado. There are eight men’s and seven women’s teams that compete in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I athletics and the Football Bowl Subdivision. Georgia Tech is a member of the Coastal Division in the Atlantic Coast Conference.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
New Mexico State Aggies Logo
The New Mexico State University teams are called the Aggies, a nickname derived from the university’s agricultural beginnings. The mascot is known as “Pistol Pete”. NMSU’s colors are crimson and white. Since 2005 the Aggies have competed in the Western Athletic Conference in all men’s and women’s sports with the exception of football in which the Aggies have been Independent since 2018. New Mexico State sponsors six men’s and ten women’s teams in NCAA sanctioned sports.
You can download theNew Mexico State Aggieslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: New Mexico State Aggies
item.description: The New Mexico State University teams are called the Aggies, a nickname derived from the university’s agricultural beginnings. The mascot is known as “Pistol Pete”. NMSU’s colors are crimson and white. Since 2005 the Aggies have competed in the Western Athletic Conference in all men’s and women’s sports with the exception of football in which the Aggies have been Independent since 2018. New Mexico State sponsors six men’s and ten women’s teams in NCAA sanctioned sports.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Southern Illinois Salukis Logo
The Southern Illinois Salukis are the varsity athletic teams representing Southern Illinois University Carbondale. The nickname comes from the Saluki, the Royal Dog of Egypt and the Persian greyhound, which ties into the fact that southern Illinois has had the nickname “Little Egypt” for just under 200 years. The Salukis play their home basketball games at Banterra Center and football games at Saluki Stadium. Southern Illinois University was a member of the Illinois Intercollegiate Athletic Conference from 1913 to 1962.
You can download theSouthern Illinois Salukislogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Southern Illinois Salukis
item.description: The Southern Illinois Salukis are the varsity athletic teams representing Southern Illinois University Carbondale. The nickname comes from the Saluki, the Royal Dog of Egypt and the Persian greyhound, which ties into the fact that southern Illinois has had the nickname “Little Egypt” for just under 200 years. The Salukis play their home basketball games at Banterra Center and football games at Saluki Stadium. Southern Illinois University was a member of the Illinois Intercollegiate Athletic Conference from 1913 to 1962.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Syracuse Orange Logo
The Syracuse Orange are the athletic teams that represent Syracuse University. The school is a member of NCAA Division I and the Atlantic Coast Conference. Until 2013, Syracuse was a member of the Big East Conference. The school’s mascot is Otto the Orange. Until 2004, the teams were known as the Orangemen and Orangewomen. The men’s basketball, football, wrestling, men’s lacrosse, and women’s basketball teams play in the Carrier Dome.
You can download theSyracuse Orangelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >

The men’s basketball, football, wrestling, men’s lacrosse, and women’s basketball teams play in the Carrier Dome.
